parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral advertising in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to "Brian Cristian," who is identified as a candidate in the text.  While not explicitly stating his party affiliation within the post itself, the "USR Maramures" byline strongly implies he is a USR candidate. The post encourages voters to vote for candidates who will be their voice in Parliament. This directly relates to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags and the general message are aimed at a broad public, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to positively influence voters' opinions of Brian Cristian and encourage them to vote for him in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  The post highlights his achievements ("largest presence," "most legislative initiatives," "most time speaking") to present him favorably. The call to action ("vote for candidates who will be your voice") directly aims to influence voting behavior.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not adhere to journalistic standards of objectivity and impartiality. It presents information selectively to promote Brian Cristian, lacking the balanced reporting expected in journalistic content.  The focus is on self-promotion rather than objective reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted promotional message designed to sway voters.  The claims made are presented as factual, not subjective opinions.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1043264764266897</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (Brian Cristian), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is given as 1732867200, which needs to be checked against the actual election date to confirm if it's after the official end of the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (to increase votes for Brian Cristian), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting by presenting biased information to promote the candidate. The presence of the CMF number further solidifies its nature as electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1043264764266897) cu conținut electoral, care promovează candidatul Brian Cristian, prezentându-l într-o lumină favorabilă și îndemnând la vot pentru acesta. Postarea, care conține numărul CMF 11240015, depășește limitele jurnalismului obiectiv, având ca efect electoral influențarea voturilor în favoarea lui Brian Cristian.  Textul postării, "La alegerile parlamentare din 1 decembrie votați candidați care să fie vocea voastră în Parlament", constituie o îndemnare directă la vot pentru un anumit candidat, încalcând astfel legislația electorală.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
